content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the implementation of this task in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    md_ast = parse_md(md) # Parse markdown to AbstractSyntaxTree
    
    code_blocks = filter(x -> x.head == :code, md_ast.content)

    joined_code_blocks = join([replace(string(c.args[1]), r"```" => "") for c in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code_blocks
end
```
This function works by first parsing the markdown to an AbstractSyntaxTree (AST), then filtering out only the code blocks. For each block, it removes any surrounding code fences with `replace` and joins all blocks together with a newline character.
